The Utus : Attila vs Arnegisclus


The Huns vs Eastern Rome Moesia II, 447 AD


 The Catalaunian Fields : Attila vs Aetius and Theodoric


The Huns vs Western Rome and the Visigoths Gaul, 451 AD

Attila features two of the few major battles the armies of the Hunnic Confederation under King Attila fought against Rome: The Utus against Eastern Rome and the Catalaunian Fields against Western Rome. Gamers have the opportunity to pit the Huns both at their peak at the Utus, and then at somewhat reduced ability at the Catalaunian Fields against the rather different armies of Eastern and Western Rome.

The module includes 140 counters depicting the Huns and other barbarian notables, including the Visigoths, Alans, Burgundians, Franks, Saxons, and Gepids. For the Romans, the Cheiroballistra artillery makes its debut. Attila includes a full size map.

The Attila module introduces some changes to the Cataphract rules including the elimination of the Size rating and the reassessment of the missile fire effectiveness of the composite bow based on the latest research.In addition, Attila includes special rules to account for the unique style of steppe warfare practiced by the nomadic Huns - the feigned retreat along with rules covering defections and barbarian impetuosity.

Simple GBoH versions of both battles are included.

Note: To play Attila: Scourge of Rome, you need a copy of Cataphract.

COMPONENTS :

 140 full-color counters
 One full-color 22x34" mapsheet
 16-page Rules and Scenario book




DESIGNERS Mark Herman and Richard Berg
MAP ART Mark Simonitch
COUNTER ART Mark Simonitch, Rodger B. MacGowan

(source: slight adaptation from GMT's website)
